revised_title: Deep Slope Fishing Expedition in the Indian Ocean: Results and Findings
tldr: The Royal Society Indian Ocean Deep Slope Fishing Expedition in 1969 caught 638 fish species from depths of 100 to 1000 meters. Although the primary goal of finding the coelacanth was not achieved, the expedition provided valuable data on the deep-sea fish fauna in the area. The study highlights the challenges of fishing in steep and rocky bottoms and the methods used to catch the fish, such as drop lines and specialized fishing gear.
